summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to an attorney named Dan, notifying him of a court conference scheduled by Judge Berman regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The conference is set for August 27, 2019, and victims are allowed to be heard.

persons.name: Dan
persons.context: Recipient of the email, presumably an attorney representing a client (likely a victim) in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge who scheduled the conference regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein after his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant whose indictment is the subject of the scheduled dismissal conference.

connections.description: Dan is an attorney whose client may be affected by the court proceedings presided over by Judge Berman.

events.title: Court Conference on Dismissal of Epstein Indictment
events.description: Judge Berman scheduled a conference to discuss the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. Victims were allowed to be heard during the proceeding.

locations: Courtroom 17B, 500 Pearl Street courthouse, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A court conference was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to discuss dismissing the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
Judge Berman allowed victims to be heard directly or through counsel during the conference.
The U.S. Attorney's Office offered travel assistance for victims who could not afford to attend the conference.
